{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3490789,"name":"Arthur","username":"JoaoArthur","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joaoarthur/{size}/245332_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:11:50.597Z","cooked":"

Good afternoon everyone, in recent years our team has avoided using the NEO 550 motors, due to a lack of wisdom and how we can couple it to the robot, either directly or with reduction boxes, but we also don’t have the inline to transform it on an original NEO axis and do the coupling on the MAX planetary, making it possible to use only the UltraPlanetary. We also have the issue that the engines burn/smoke very easily, which makes us even more afraid of using them in our robot. Do you have any tips on how we can use these engines?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:11:50.597Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":89,"reads":322,"readers_count":321,"score":524.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483232,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-use-the-neo-550","display_username":"Arthur","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59215,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CAD/Eletrical Mentor| BrainMachine-FRC"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-use-the-neo-550/483232/1","custom_user_title":"CAD/Eletrical Mentor| BrainMachine-FRC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3490797,"name":"Sam","username":"clydefrog88","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/clydefrog88/{size}/150683_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:17:56.757Z","cooked":"

A 20A current limit and the UltraPlanetary are great for low shock load tasks.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:18:27.811Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":310,"readers_count":309,"score":107.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":483232,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-use-the-neo-550","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/neo-550-brushless-motor-locked-rotor-testing/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"NEO 550 Brushless Motor - Locked-rotor Testing","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-use-the-neo-550/483232/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490798,"name":"Josh (he/him)","username":"Josh_Fox","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/josh_fox/{size}/119506_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:18:37.899Z","cooked":"

4680 has had a lot of success relying on Neo 550s for things like running intake rollers and extending or rotating relatively lightweight structures.

The first thing we do when creating a controller object corresponding to a Neo 550 motor in code is set up current limits to 20A or less, ensuring the motor can stall indefinitely without frying the motor.

If you find yourself needing more torque than the Neo 550 can put out at that current limit through a multi-stage UltraPlanetary reduction, it’s probably time to pick a different motor or seriously evaluate how you can avoid stalling if it’s the “right motor” in all other aspects.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T18:16:16.511Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":160.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483232,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-use-the-neo-550","display_username":"Josh (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8270,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Detroiter"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-use-the-neo-550/483232/3","custom_user_title":"Detroiter","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490799,"name":"Arthur","username":"JoaoArthur","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joaoarthur/{size}/245332_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:23:43.026Z","cooked":"

Thank you very much guys, let’s do the tests. But I believe that reducing the current will help a lot.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:23:43.026Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":254,"readers_count":253,"score":75.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483232,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-use-the-neo-550","display_username":"Arthur","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59215,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CAD/Eletrical Mentor| BrainMachine-FRC"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-use-the-neo-550/483232/4","custom_user_title":"CAD/Eletrical Mentor| BrainMachine-FRC","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490810,"name":"Eric Tate","username":"MrT8","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrt8/{size}/9889_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:36:37.367Z","cooked":"

Genreally speaking, NEO550s require significant gear reduction for things like intake rollers as its free speed is very high (11,000 RPM). We are often using something in the order of 30:1 reduction.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:36:37.367Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":42.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483232,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-use-the-neo-550","display_username":"Eric Tate","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59215,"username":"JoaoArthur","name":"Arthur","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joaoarthur/{size}/245332_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31332,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-use-the-neo-550/483232/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490812,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T17:40:43.120Z","cooked":"

The max planetary base kit should have an adapter plate to mount it to a neo 550. The max planetary is way over kill but we needed a longer output shaft than the ultra planetary or the versa planetary for our mechanism in 2023 and the max planetary was the best option. I will admit that we will be moving away from them in the future to use the minion. 80% of the reason is to get away from the tiny motor shaft and just be able to slide on a spline adapter.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-23T17:40:43.120Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":205,"readers_count":204,"score":56.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":483232,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-use-the-neo-550","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59215,"username":"JoaoArthur","name":"Arthur","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joaoarthur/{size}/245332_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-use-the-neo-550/483232/6","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3490881,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T19:04:22.554Z","cooked":"

Typically we use a NEO 550 when the power requirements are relatively low and we are trying hard to minimize weight (eg at the end of an arm).

Definitely agree with a current limit, as they love to release their magic smoke if stalled w/o one.

In the future, quite possibly the Minion or X44 will take its place in our ecosystem.

We are well aware of this magical little smoke, it has happened to us several times lol

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T03:18:29.756Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":40.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483232,"topic_slug":"how-do-you-use-the-neo-550","display_username":"Arthur","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59215,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CAD/Eletrical Mentor| BrainMachine-FRC"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-you-use-the-neo-550/483232/8","custom_user_title":"CAD/Eletrical Mentor| BrainMachine-FRC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3491365,"name":"Arthur","username":"JoaoArthur","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joaoarthur/{size}/245332_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T03:23:11.264Z","cooked":"

Thank you very much guys, we did some tests (starting from short periods of use to the most sudden tests possible, to make sure it doesn’t let us down) and they were all very satisfactory, without any magical smoke that always occurred to us. .

Below is the graph of all the tests we carried out, thank you very much for your support, if you want you can comment on these graphs!

Spark_550(1)2038×597 102 KB

Spark_550(2)2038×597 78.3 KB

Spark_550(3)2038×597 83.1 KB

Spark_550(4)2038×597 89.4 KB

Spark_550(5)2038×597 159 KB

Spark_550(6)1920×562 152 KB
